level-up.name: quick-attack
level-up.description:
The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes
it almost invisible. This move always goes first.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: foresight
level-up.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
level-up.effect: Resets the target's evasion to normal and prevents any further boosting until the target leaves the field.  A ghost under this effect takes normal damage from normal and fighting moves.  This move itself ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

level-up.name: endure
level-up.description:
The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP.
Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
level-up.effect:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

level-up.name: counter
level-up.description:
A retaliation move that counters any physical attack,
inflicting double the damage taken.
level-up.effect:
Targets the last opposing Pokémon to hit the user with a physical move this turn.  Inflicts twice the damage that move did to the user.  If there is no eligible target, this move will fail.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

level-up.name: force-palm
level-up.description:
The target is attacked with a shock wave. This may
also leave the target with paralysis.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

level-up.name: feint
level-up.description:
This attack hits a target using a move such as
Protect or Detect.
This also lifts the effects of those moves.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Removes the effects of detect or protect from the target before hitting.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

level-up.name: reversal
level-up.description:
An all-out attack that becomes more powerful the
less HP the user has.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power varies inversely with the user's proportional remaining HP.

64 * current HP / max HP | Power
-----------------------: | ----:
 0– 1                    |  200
 2– 5                    |  150
 6–12                    |  100
13–21                    |   80
22–42                    |   40
43–64                    |   20

level-up.name: screech
level-up.description:
An earsplitting screech harshly lowers the target’s
Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by two stages.

level-up.name: copycat
level-up.description:
The user mimics the move used immediately before
it. The move fails if no other move has been
used yet.
level-up.effect:
Uses the last move that was used successfully by any Pokémon, including the user.

This move cannot copy itself, nor roar nor whirlwind.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

egg.name: bite
egg.description:
The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs.
This may also make the target flinch.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

egg.name: low-kick
egg.description:
A powerful low kick that makes the target fall over.
The heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

egg.name: agility
egg.description:
The user relaxes and lightens its body to move
faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.
egg.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

egg.name: high-jump-kick
egg.description:
The target is attacked with a knee kick from a jump.
If it misses, the user is hurt instead.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage. If this move misses, is blocked by protect or detect, or has no effect, the user takes damage equal to half of its max HP rounded down.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

egg.name: mind-reader
egg.description:
The user senses the target’s movements with its
mind to ensure its next attack does not miss
the target.
egg.effect:
If the user targets the same target again before the end of the next turn, the move it uses is guaranteed to hit.  This move itself also ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

One-hit KO moves are also guaranteed to hit, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  This effect also allows the user to hit Pokémon that are off the field due to moves such as dig or fly.

If the target uses detect or protect while under the effect of this move, the user is not guaranteed to hit, but has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.

egg.name: detect
egg.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
egg.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: cross-chop
egg.description:
The user delivers a double chop with its forearms
crossed. Critical hits land more easily.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

egg.name: crunch
egg.description:
The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

egg.name: blaze-kick
egg.description:
The user launches a kick that lands a critical hit
more easily. This may also leave the target with
a burn.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move. Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

egg.name: sky-uppercut
egg.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.

This move can hit Pokémon under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky drop.

egg.name: iron-defense
egg.description:
The user hardens its body’s surface like iron,
sharply raising its Defense stat.
egg.effect: Raises the user's Defense by two stages.

egg.name: vacuum-wave
egg.description:
The user whirls its fists to send a wave of pure
vacuum at the target. This move always goes first.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: bullet-punch
egg.description:
The user strikes the target with tough punches as
fast as bullets. This move always goes first.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

tutor.name: ice-punch
tutor.description:
The target is punched with an icy fist. This may also
leave the target frozen.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

tutor.name: thunder-punch
tutor.description:
The target is punched with an electrified fist.
This may also leave the target with paralysis.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

tutor.name: swift
tutor.description:
Star-shaped rays are shot at opposing Pokémon.
This attack never misses.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

tutor.name: snore
tutor.description:
This attack can be used only if the user is asleep.
The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.
tutor.effect: Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: mud-slap
tutor.description:
The user hurls mud in the target’s face to inflict
damage and lower its accuracy.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.

tutor.name: fury-cutter
tutor.description:
The target is slashed with scythes or claws. This
attack becomes more powerful if it hits
in succession.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power doubles after every time this move is used, whether consecutively or not, maxing out at 16x.  If this move misses or the user leaves the field, power resets.

tutor.name: helping-hand
tutor.description:
The user assists an ally by boosting the power of
that ally’s attack.
tutor.effect:
Boosts the power of the target's moves by 50% until the end of this turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

tutor.name: iron-defense
tutor.description:
The user hardens its body’s surface like iron,
sharply raising its Defense stat.
tutor.effect: Raises the user's Defense by two stages.

tutor.name: magnet-rise
tutor.description:
The user levitates using electrically generated
magnetism for five turns.
tutor.effect:
For five turns, the user is immune to ground moves.

If the user is under the effect of ingrain or has levitate, this move will fail.

This effect is temporarily disabled by and cannot be used during gravity.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.

tutor.name: vacuum-wave
tutor.description:
The user whirls its fists to send a wave of pure
vacuum at the target. This move always goes first.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

tutor.name: zen-headbutt
tutor.description:
The user focuses its willpower to its head and
attacks the target. This may also make the
target flinch.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: focus-punch
machine.description:
The user focuses its mind before launching a punch.
This move fails if the user is hit before it is used.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the user takes damage this turn before hitting, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: strength
machine.description:
The target is slugged with a punch thrown at
maximum power.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: roar
machine.description:
The target is scared off, and a different Pokémon is
dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a
single Pokémon.
machine.effect:
Switches the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon selected at random.  Wild battles end immediately.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction cups or under the effect of ingrain.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: rock-smash
machine.description:
The user attacks with a punch. This may also lower
the target’s Defense stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

machine.name: bulk-up
machine.description:
The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body,
raising both its Attack and Defense stats.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: rain-dance
machine.description:
The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five
turns, powering up Water-type moves. It lowers
the power of Fire-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar beam has half power.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects, and Pokémon with rain dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: iron-tail
machine.description:
The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

machine.name: earthquake
machine.description:
The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every
Pokémon around it.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dig, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: dig
machine.description:
The user burrows into the ground, then attacks on
the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User digs underground for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, earthquake, fissure, and magnitude still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: brick-break
machine.description:
The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also break
barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect.
machine.effect: Destroys any light screen or reflect on the target's side of the field, then inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: rock-tomb
machine.description:
Boulders are hurled at the target. This also lowers
the target’s Speed stat by preventing its movement.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: secret-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyzes target

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Courtyard      | Paralyzes target

Magma          | Makes target flinch

Neon           | Paralyzes target
Stargazer      | Makes target flinch
Sunny Park     | Puts target to sleep
Sunset         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Waterfall      | Puts target to sleep

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: focus-blast
machine.description:
The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes
its power. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: fling
machine.description:

This move’s power and effects depend on the item.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held item.  The item is consumed.  If the user is not holding an item, or its item has no set type and power, this move will fail.

This move ignores sticky hold.

If the user is under the effect of embargo, this move will fail.

machine.description:
The user slashes with a sharp claw made from

machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

The user stores power, then attacks. If the user

be doubled.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target uses a move or switches out this turn before this move is used, this move has double power.

machine.description:

machine.description:
This move can’t be used.

machine.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.

machine.description:

machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: sleep-talk
machine.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: natural-gift
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.

machine.name: poison-jab
machine.description:
The target is stabbed with a tentacle, arm, or the like
steeped in poison. This may also poison the target.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

Targets the last opposing Pokémon to hit the user with a physical move this turn.  Inflicts twice the damage that move did to the user.  If there is no eligible target, this move will fail.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

level-up.name: feint
level-up.description:
This attack hits a target using a move such as
Protect or Detect.
This also lifts the effects of those moves.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Removes the effects of detect or protect from the target before hitting.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

level-up.name: force-palm
level-up.description:
The target is attacked with a shock wave. This may
also leave the target with paralysis.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

level-up.name: copycat
level-up.description:
The user mimics the move used immediately before
it. The move fails if no other move has been
used yet.
level-up.effect:
Uses the last move that was used successfully by any Pokémon, including the user.

This move cannot copy itself, nor roar nor whirlwind.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

level-up.name: screech
level-up.description:
An earsplitting screech harshly lowers the target’s
Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by two stages.

level-up.name: reversal
level-up.description:
An all-out attack that becomes more powerful the
less HP the user has.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power varies inversely with the user's proportional remaining HP.

64 * current HP / max HP | Power
-----------------------: | ----:
 0– 1                    |  200
 2– 5                    |  150
 6–12                    |  100
13–21                    |   80
22–42                    |   40
43–64                    |   20

level-up.name: nasty-plot
level-up.description:
The user stimulates its brain by thinking bad
thoughts. This sharply raises the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's Special Attack by two stages.

level-up.name: final-gambit
level-up.description:
The user risks everything to attack its target. The
user faints but does damage equal to its HP.
level-up.effect: Inflicts damage equal to the user's remaining HP.  User faints.

egg.name: bite
egg.description:
The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs.
This may also make the target flinch.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

egg.name: low-kick
egg.description:
A powerful low kick that makes the target fall over.
The heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

egg.name: agility
egg.description:
The user relaxes and lightens its body to move
faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.
egg.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

egg.name: high-jump-kick
egg.description:
The target is attacked with a knee kick from a jump.
If it misses, the user is hurt instead.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage. If this move misses, is blocked by protect or detect, or has no effect, the user takes damage equal to half of its max HP rounded down.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

egg.name: mind-reader
egg.description:
The user senses the target’s movements with its
mind to ensure its next attack does not miss
the target.
egg.effect:
If the user targets the same target again before the end of the next turn, the move it uses is guaranteed to hit.  This move itself also ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

One-hit KO moves are also guaranteed to hit, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  This effect also allows the user to hit Pokémon that are off the field due to moves such as dig or fly.

If the target uses detect or protect while under the effect of this move, the user is not guaranteed to hit, but has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.

egg.name: detect
egg.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
egg.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: cross-chop
egg.description:
The user delivers a double chop with its forearms
crossed. Critical hits land more easily.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

egg.name: crunch
egg.description:
The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

egg.name: follow-me
egg.description:
The user draws attention to itself, making all targets
take aim only at the user.
egg.effect:
Until the end of this turn, any moves that opposing Pokémon target solely at the user's ally will instead target the user.  If both Pokémon on the same side of the field use this move on the same turn, the Pokémon that uses it last will become the target.

This effect takes priority over lightning rod and storm drain.

If the user's ally switches out, opposing Pokémon may still hit it with pursuit.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: blaze-kick
egg.description:
The user launches a kick that lands a critical hit
more easily. This may also leave the target with
a burn.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move. Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

egg.name: sky-uppercut

This move can’t be used.

Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.

This move can hit Pokémon under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky drop.

egg.name: iron-defense

The user hardens its body’s surface like iron,

egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: bullet-punch
egg.description:
The user strikes the target with tough punches as

egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

The target is thrown, and a different Pokémon is

If the target is under the effect of ingrain or suction cups, or it has a substitute, or its Trainer has no more usable Pokémon, it will not be switched out.  If the target is a wild Pokémon, the battle ends instead.

This may also leave the target with paralysis.

A powerful low kick that makes the target fall over.
The heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.
tutor.effect:

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100

This attack can be used only if the user is asleep.

tutor.effect: Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

tutor.name: iron-tail
tutor.description:
The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

tutor.name: helping-hand
tutor.description:
The user assists an ally by boosting the power of
that ally’s attack.
tutor.effect:
Boosts the power of the target's moves by 50% until the end of this turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

tutor.name: role-play
tutor.description:
The user mimics the target completely, copying the

User's ability is replaced with the target's until the user leaves the field.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

If the target has flower gift, forecast, illusion, imposter, multitype, stance change, trace, wonder guard, or zen mode, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

tutor.name: iron-defense
tutor.description:
The user hardens its body’s surface like iron,
sharply raising its Defense stat.
tutor.effect: Raises the user's Defense by two stages.

tutor.name: magnet-rise

The user levitates using electrically generated

tutor.effect:
For five turns, the user is immune to ground moves.

If the user is under the effect of ingrain or has levitate, this move will fail.

tutor.name: drain-punch

An energy-draining punch. The user’s HP is restored

tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

tutor.name: zen-headbutt

The user focuses its willpower to its head and

tutor.name: dual-chop

machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: roar
machine.description:

single Pokémon.
machine.effect:
Switches the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon selected at random.  Wild battles end immediately.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction cups or under the effect of ingrain.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: bulk-up
machine.description:
The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body,
raising both its Attack and Defense stats.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: rain-dance
machine.description:
The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five
turns, powering up Water-type moves. It lowers
the power of Fire-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar beam has half power.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects, and Pokémon with rain dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: earthquake
machine.description:
The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every
Pokémon around it.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dig, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: dig
machine.description:
The user burrows into the ground, then attacks on
the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User digs underground for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, earthquake, fissure, and magnitude still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: brick-break
machine.description:
The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also break
barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect.
machine.effect: Destroys any light screen or reflect on the target's side of the field, then inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: rock-tomb
machine.description:
Boulders are hurled at the target. This also lowers
the target’s Speed stat by preventing its movement.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: low-sweep
machine.description:
The user makes a swift attack on the target’s legs,
which lowers the target’s Speed stat.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: focus-blast
machine.description:
The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes
its power. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: fling
machine.description:
The user flings its held item at the target to attack.
This move’s power and effects depend on the item.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held item.  The item is consumed.  If the user is not holding an item, or its item has no set type and power, this move will fail.

This move ignores sticky hold.

If the user is under the effect of embargo, this move will fail.

machine.name: shadow-claw
machine.description:
The user slashes with a sharp claw made from
shadows. Critical hits land more easily.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

machine.name: payback
machine.description:
The user stores power, then attacks. If the user
moves after the target, this attack’s power will
be doubled.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target uses a move or switches out this turn before this move is used, this move has double power.

machine.name: retaliate
machine.description:
The user gets revenge for a fainted ally. If an ally
fainted in the previous turn, this move’s power
is increased.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If a friendly Pokémon fainted on the previous turn, this move has double power.

machine.name: swords-dance
machine.description:
A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit.
This sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

machine.name: bulldoze

machine.name: rock-slide

Pokémon flinch.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: work-up
machine.description:
The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk
stats increase.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.

machine.name: poison-jab
machine.description:
The target is stabbed with a tentacle, arm, or the like
steeped in poison. This may also poison the target.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

Protect or Detect.

level-up.name: force-palm
level-up.description:
The target is attacked with a shock wave. This may
also leave the target with paralysis.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

level-up.name: copycat
level-up.description:
The user mimics the move used immediately before
it. The move fails if no other move has been
used yet.
level-up.effect:
Uses the last move that was used successfully by any Pokémon, including the user.

This move cannot copy itself, nor roar nor whirlwind.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

level-up.name: screech
level-up.description:
An earsplitting screech harshly lowers the target’s
Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by two stages.

level-up.name: reversal
level-up.description:
An all-out attack that becomes more powerful the
less HP the user has.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power varies inversely with the user's proportional remaining HP.

64 * current HP / max HP | Power
-----------------------: | ----:
 0– 1                    |  200
 2– 5                    |  150
 6–12                    |  100
13–21                    |   80
22–42                    |   40
43–64                    |   20

level-up.name: nasty-plot
level-up.description:
The user stimulates its brain by thinking bad
thoughts. This sharply raises the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's Special Attack by two stages.

level-up.name: final-gambit
level-up.description:
The user risks everything to attack its target. The
user faints but does damage equal to its HP.
level-up.effect: Inflicts damage equal to the user's remaining HP.  User faints.

egg.name: bite
egg.description:
The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs.
This may also make the target flinch.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

egg.name: low-kick
egg.description:
A powerful low kick that makes the target fall over.
The heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

egg.name: agility
egg.description:
The user relaxes and lightens its body to move
faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.
egg.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

egg.name: high-jump-kick
egg.description:
The target is attacked with a knee kick from a jump.
If it misses, the user is hurt instead.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage. If this move misses, is blocked by protect or detect, or has no effect, the user takes damage equal to half of its max HP rounded down.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

egg.name: mind-reader
egg.description:
The user senses the target’s movements with its
mind to ensure its next attack does not miss
the target.
egg.effect:
If the user targets the same target again before the end of the next turn, the move it uses is guaranteed to hit.  This move itself also ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

One-hit KO moves are also guaranteed to hit, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  This effect also allows the user to hit Pokémon that are off the field due to moves such as dig or fly.

If the target uses detect or protect while under the effect of this move, the user is not guaranteed to hit, but has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.

egg.name: detect
egg.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
egg.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: cross-chop
egg.description:
The user delivers a double chop with its forearms
crossed. Critical hits land more easily.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

egg.name: crunch
egg.description:
The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

egg.name: follow-me
egg.description:
The user draws attention to itself, making all targets
take aim only at the user.
egg.effect:
Until the end of this turn, any moves that opposing Pokémon target solely at the user's ally will instead target the user.  If both Pokémon on the same side of the field use this move on the same turn, the Pokémon that uses it last will become the target.

This effect takes priority over lightning rod and storm drain.

If the user's ally switches out, opposing Pokémon may still hit it with pursuit.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: blaze-kick
egg.description:
The user launches a kick that lands a critical hit
more easily. This may also leave the target with
a burn.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move. Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

egg.name: sky-uppercut
egg.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.

This move can hit Pokémon under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky drop.

egg.name: iron-defense
egg.description:
The user hardens its body’s surface like iron,
sharply raising its Defense stat.
egg.effect: Raises the user's Defense by two stages.

egg.name: vacuum-wave
egg.description:
The user whirls its fists to send a wave of pure
vacuum at the target. This move always goes first.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: bullet-punch
egg.description:
The user strikes the target with tough punches as
fast as bullets. This move always goes first.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: circle-throw
egg.description:
The target is thrown, and a different Pokémon is
dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against
a single Pokémon.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then switches the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon, selected at random.

If the target is under the effect of ingrain or suction cups, or it has a substitute, or its Trainer has no more usable Pokémon, it will not be switched out.  If the target is a wild Pokémon, the battle ends instead.

machine.name: strength
machine.description:
The target is slugged with a punch thrown at
maximum power.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: roar
machine.description:
The target is scared off, and a different Pokémon is
dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a
single Pokémon.
machine.effect:
Switches the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon selected at random.  Wild battles end immediately.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction cups or under the effect of ingrain.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: bulk-up
machine.description:
The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body,
raising both its Attack and Defense stats.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: rain-dance
machine.description:
The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five
turns, powering up Water-type moves. It lowers
the power of Fire-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar beam has half power.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects, and Pokémon with rain dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: earthquake
machine.description:
The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every
Pokémon around it.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dig, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: dig
machine.description:
The user burrows into the ground, then attacks on
the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User digs underground for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, earthquake, fissure, and magnitude still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: brick-break
machine.description:
The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also break
barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect.
machine.effect: Destroys any light screen or reflect on the target's side of the field, then inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: rock-tomb
machine.description:
Boulders are hurled at the target. This also lowers
the target’s Speed stat by preventing its movement.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: low-sweep
machine.description:
The user makes a swift attack on the target’s legs,
which lowers the target’s Speed stat.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: focus-blast
machine.description:
The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes
its power. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: fling
machine.description:
The user flings its held item at the target to attack.
This move’s power and effects depend on the item.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held item.  The item is consumed.  If the user is not holding an item, or its item has no set type and power, this move will fail.

This move ignores sticky hold.

If the user is under the effect of embargo, this move will fail.

machine.name: shadow-claw
machine.description:
The user slashes with a sharp claw made from
shadows. Critical hits land more easily.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

machine.name: payback
machine.description:
The user stores power, then attacks. If the user
moves after the target, this attack’s power will
be doubled.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target uses a move or switches out this turn before this move is used, this move has double power.

machine.name: retaliate
machine.description:
The user gets revenge for a fainted ally. If an ally
fainted in the previous turn, this move’s power
is increased.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If a friendly Pokémon fainted on the previous turn, this move has double power.

machine.name: swords-dance
machine.description:
A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit.
This sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

machine.name: bulldoze
machine.description:
The user strikes everything around it by stomping
down on the ground. This lowers the Speed stats of
those hit.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: rock-slide
machine.description:
Large boulders are hurled at opposing Pokémon to
inflict damage. This may also make the opposing
Pokémon flinch.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: poison-jab
machine.description:
The target is stabbed with a tentacle, arm, or the like
steeped in poison. This may also poison the target.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: sleep-talk
machine.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

machine.name: rock-smash
machine.description:
The user attacks with a punch. This may also lower
the target’s Defense stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

machine.name: power-up-punch
machine.description:
Striking opponents over and over makes the user’s
fists harder. Hitting a target raises the Attack stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Attack by one stage.

machine.name: confide
machine.description:
The user tells the target a secret, and the target
loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers
the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.

level-up.name: quick-attack
level-up.description:
The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes
it almost invisible. This move always goes first.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: foresight
level-up.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
level-up.effect: Resets the target's evasion to normal and prevents any further boosting until the target leaves the field.  A ghost under this effect takes normal damage from normal and fighting moves.  This move itself ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

level-up.name: endure

level-up.effect:

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

level-up.name: counter
level-up.description:
A retaliation move that counters any physical attack,
inflicting double the damage taken.
level-up.effect:
Targets the last opposing Pokémon to hit the user with a physical move this turn.  Inflicts twice the damage that move did to the user.  If there is no eligible target, this move will fail.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

level-up.name: feint
level-up.description:
This attack hits a target using a move such as
Protect or Detect.
This also lifts the effects of those moves.
level-up.effect:

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.
